title: Are you smarter than Wittgenstein? - Quora

response.answer_text: I live 5 minutes down the road from where Wittengentein is buried. Because he is dead, right now I’m infinitely more smart than him because dead people are zero smart. I could out-smart him in every way today. Also Wittgenstein was a particular kind of smart. Very good at reasoning, but very poor at emotional intelligence. So it would not take much to be more emotionally smart than him - probably the average dog could have out-smarted him emotionally.

When he was alive, I suspect that Ludwig Wittgenstein was more intelligent than about 90% of the people he shared the planet with. Philosophical issues aside, he was also quite musical and helped design a house for his sister in Vienna (he designed everything from the heating system to the device for raising and lowering the window blinds to the door handles—he personally oversaw the manufacture and installation of all this). The brilliant philosopher Bertrand Russell clearly considered him a genius and, frankly, was a saint in the degree of his tolerance for Wittgenstein’s volatile temperament and assorted mishegas. I’m not even as smart as Bertrand Russell’s lamest student.

The only way I can even remotely be considered wiser than Wittgenstein is that I am intelligent enough to realize that I am on no way more intelligent than Wittgenstein, save the the way currently being mentioned.
